entry.title: ETH-EPFL Sciencepreneurship Summer School 2023
entry.content:
Going 0ï¸âƒ£â¡ï¸1ï¸âƒ£ can be very hard but very rewarding: starting from an idea ğŸŒ±, partnering up with my long-time collaborator Julia Wagner ğŸ¤, and last week successfully delivering the first ETH-EPFL Sciencepreneurship Summer School in Zurich, Switzerland, has been exactly such a rewarding journey! ğŸš€

ğŸ”¥ This is a story of intersecting supportive #innovation communities and setting them up for #success. We succeeded in bringing together an exclusive but diverse group of 30 of the most entrepreneurial graduate #students from globally leading #universities with experienced #sciencepreneurs and ecosystem players.

Going from an idea and 2 co-founders, to a vibrant summer school and community!

Community

Bringing together a community of (1) students, (2) experienced sciencepreneurs, and (3) ecosystem players.

Program

Interactive lectures & workshops ğŸ¤“

The program and its lecturers were definitely not your average course experience:

  • day 1: #opportunity identification by Anil Sethi, #vision by Alex Ilic, #team and #pitching by Antonia Albert - Stephan Seyboth - Isabelle Siegrist,
  • day 2: tech #commercialization by Jana Thiel, #legal by Umberto Milano, #business models by RÃ©ginald Bien-AimÃ©,
  • day 3: #gtm by William R. Cockayne, Ph.D., #venturefinancing by Cynthia Jurytko, #IP & #equity by Alex Ilic - Claudia Scheckel,
  • day 4: selling to customers by Georges Khneysser, selling to VCs by Thomas Meier, #society & #diversity by Nettra Pan ğŸ‘.

Panel discussions ğŸ¯

A set of three inspiring panels on

  • â€œgoing from idea to exitâ€ with Murielle Schreck, Pascal Weinberger, Herbert Bay
  • â€œfunding opportunities & risksâ€ with Karim Maizar, Antonia Albert, Georges Khneysser, Gabriele Schwarz
  • â€œunconventional sciencepreneursâ€ with Christophe Moser, Roland Siegwart, HervÃ© Lebret

Socials

ğŸ¥‚ Work hard, play hard: hotel ğŸ¨, drinks ğŸ¹, and all food ğŸ½ï¸ at the faculty club covered. Boat apÃ©ro trip on Lake Zurich â›µ & partner apÃ©ro at the new ETH AI Center ğŸ¦¾.

Pitches

ğŸ¤ All these learnings culminated in team project pitches with jury Christophe Moser, Roland Siegwart, HervÃ© Lebret, and Tomas Brenner.

Thanks ğŸ™

Next to thanking foremost the best possible co-organizer Julia Wagner, there are many people and organizations to thank here, including:

  • EPFL and ETH ZÃ¼rich for providing the joint Summer School framework! Thanks everyone for helping build this supportive community, and I am grateful for all the spontaneous positive oral, email, and text messages as well as the participantsâ€™ unexpected tasty gift to us, the organizers! ğŸ«
  • My professional network and my incredibly supportive mentors! You know who you are ;).
  • A special mention goes to our formal academic supporters and reliable professors Christophe Moser and Hans Gersbach.

Future

ğŸ‘ Follow, like, comment, and repost for more updates. Register your interest on https://sciencepreneurship.ch. Whatâ€™s next? Please connect and reach out if you are interested in getting involved in the future as a student, sciencepreneur, or ecosystem player! ğŸš€
entry.summary: thoughts on co-founding the first ETH-EPFL Sciencepreneurship Summer School

entry.title: EPFL guest lecture: Investment Memo
entry.content:
At the end of March 2023, David Campbell and I were invited to give a 2 hour guest lecture in the EPFL masterâ€™s course MGT-413 Entrepreneurship & new venture strategy. Specifically, lecturer Davide Bavato asked us to share hands-on how VCs evaluate startups and build investment memos to base base their decisions on.

Arnout going over the key investment criteria for VCs.
David elaborating on team properties and questions.
entry.summary: Invited guest lecture at EPFL on how VCs evaluate startups & build investment memos that they base their decisions on.

entry.summary: The second interview of our series was with Arnout Devos, Sylvain Chatel, and Matthias Grossglauser. Arnout, and Sylvain, are PhD students at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanneâ€¦
